alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 4:51PM MST until July 09 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN COCHISE COUNTY... At 451 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The heavy rain ended across the area however high water will likely continue to drain and cause problems, therefore the warning will remain in place for now. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Simon. This includes the following streams and drainages... Keating Creek, San Simon River, South Fork Keating Creek and East Whitetail Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
